chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn J Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn J Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn J Robinson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Shawn J Robinson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Shawn J Robinson was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
